name: Amoxicillin 250mg
description: Broad-spectrum antibiotic for dogs and cats.
notes: Store in a cool, dry place.

name: Carprofen 50mg
description: Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug for pain relief in dogs.

name: DHPP Vaccine
description: Combination vaccine for dogs protecting against Distemper, Hepatitis, Parvovirus, and Parainfluenza.
notes: Store refrigerated between 2-8°C. Do not freeze.
vaccine_instructions: Administer subcutaneously. Initial vaccination at 6-8 weeks, boosters at 10-12 weeks and 14-16 weeks, then annually.

name: FVRCP Vaccine
description: Feline combination vaccine protecting against Feline Viral Rhinotracheitis, Calicivirus, and Panleukopenia.
notes: Store refrigerated between 2-8°C. Protect from light.
vaccine_instructions: Administer subcutaneously. Initial vaccination at 6-8 weeks, boosters at 10-12 weeks and 14-16 weeks, then annually.

name: Rabies Vaccine
description: Rabies vaccine for dogs and cats. Required by law in many regions.
notes: Store refrigerated between 2-8°C. Legal requirement in most jurisdictions.
vaccine_instructions: Administer intramuscularly. First dose at 12-16 weeks, booster at 1 year, then every 1-3 years depending on local regulations.

name: Bordetella Vaccine
description: Intranasal vaccine for prevention of kennel cough in dogs.
notes: Store refrigerated between 2-8°C. Shake well before use.
vaccine_instructions: Administer intranasally. Can be given as early as 3 weeks of age, with annual boosters recommended for dogs in high-risk environments.

name: Leptospirosis Vaccine
description: Vaccine protecting dogs against Leptospirosis, a bacterial disease.
notes: Store refrigerated between 2-8°C. Annual booster recommended.
vaccine_instructions: Administer subcutaneously. Initial series of two doses 2-4 weeks apart, starting at 8-12 weeks of age. Annual boosters required.

name: Lyme Disease Vaccine
description: Vaccine for dogs to prevent Lyme disease transmitted by ticks.
notes: Store refrigerated between 2-8°C. Recommended for dogs in tick-endemic areas.
vaccine_instructions: Administer subcutaneously. Initial series of two doses 2-4 weeks apart, starting at 12 weeks of age. Annual boosters required.

name: Canine Influenza Vaccine
description: Vaccine protecting dogs against canine influenza virus (H3N8 and H3N2 strains).
notes: Store refrigerated between 2-8°C. Especially important for dogs in kennels or doggy daycares.
vaccine_instructions: Administer subcutaneously. Initial series of two doses 2-4 weeks apart, starting at 6-8 weeks of age. Annual boosters recommended.

name: Feline Leukemia Vaccine
description: Vaccine protecting cats against Feline Leukemia Virus (FeLV).
notes: Store refrigerated between 2-8°C. Recommended for outdoor cats or multi-cat households.
vaccine_instructions: Administer subcutaneously. Initial series of two doses 3-4 weeks apart, starting at 8-12 weeks of age. Annual boosters recommended.

name: Feline Calicivirus Vaccine
description: Vaccine protecting cats against Feline Calicivirus, a common respiratory disease.
notes: Store refrigerated between 2-8°C. Often included in FVRCP combination vaccine.
vaccine_instructions: Administer subcutaneously. Initial vaccination at 6-8 weeks, boosters at 10-12 weeks and 14-16 weeks, then annually.

name: Canine Parvovirus Vaccine
description: Monovalent vaccine specifically targeting Canine Parvovirus, a highly contagious viral disease.
notes: Store refrigerated between 2-8°C. Critical for puppies and high-risk environments.
vaccine_instructions: Administer subcutaneously. Initial vaccination at 6-8 weeks, boosters every 3-4 weeks until 16 weeks of age, then annually.

name: Feline Panleukopenia Vaccine
description: Monovalent vaccine protecting cats against Feline Panleukopenia (Feline Distemper).
notes: Store refrigerated between 2-8°C. Essential core vaccine for all cats.
vaccine_instructions: Administer subcutaneously. Initial vaccination at 6-8 weeks, boosters at 10-12 weeks and 14-16 weeks, then every 1-3 years.

name: Canine Distemper Vaccine
description: Monovalent vaccine protecting dogs against Canine Distemper virus.
notes: Store refrigerated between 2-8°C. Core vaccine for all dogs.
vaccine_instructions: Administer subcutaneously. Initial vaccination at 6-8 weeks, boosters every 3-4 weeks until 16 weeks, then every 1-3 years.

name: Feline Herpesvirus Vaccine
description: Vaccine protecting cats against Feline Herpesvirus (FHV-1), causing upper respiratory infections.
notes: Store refrigerated between 2-8°C. Often included in FVRCP combination vaccine.
vaccine_instructions: Administer subcutaneously. Initial vaccination at 6-8 weeks, boosters at 10-12 weeks and 14-16 weeks, then annually.

name: Canine Coronavirus Vaccine
description: Vaccine protecting dogs against Canine Coronavirus, causing gastrointestinal disease.
notes: Store refrigerated between 2-8°C. Non-core vaccine, recommended for high-risk environments.
vaccine_instructions: Administer subcutaneously. Initial series of two doses 2-4 weeks apart, starting at 6-8 weeks. Annual boosters recommended.

name: Feline Chlamydophila Vaccine
description: Vaccine protecting cats against Chlamydophila felis, causing conjunctivitis and respiratory disease.
notes: Store refrigerated between 2-8°C. Non-core vaccine, recommended for multi-cat households.
vaccine_instructions: Administer subcutaneously. Initial series of two doses 3-4 weeks apart, starting at 8-12 weeks. Annual boosters recommended.

name: Canine Adenovirus Type 2 Vaccine
description: Vaccine protecting dogs against Canine Adenovirus Type 2, causing respiratory disease.
notes: Store refrigerated between 2-8°C. Often included in DHPP combination vaccine.
vaccine_instructions: Administer subcutaneously. Initial vaccination at 6-8 weeks, boosters every 3-4 weeks until 16 weeks, then annually.
